snippet: Interviews in China with four North Koreans suggest daily life has not improved under Kim Jong-un for those who fall outside the nation’s elite.
abstract: Rare interviews with four North Koreans reveal that daily lives have not improved, and in fact have gotten harder, in the 10 months since Kim Jong-un took the reins of his desperately poor nation following the death of his autocratic father; sentiment is one that activists and analysts say they have also heard, despite Kim's tantalizing pronouncements about boosting people's livelihoods.

byline.contributor: Su-Hyun Lee contributed reporting from Seoul, South Korea.

lead_paragraph: Interviews in China with four North Koreans suggest daily life has not improved under Kim Jong-un for those who fall outside the nation’s elite.

headline.seo: North Koreans Say Life Has Not Improved
headline.main: North Koreans See Few Gains Below Top Tier
headline.print_headline: North Koreans See Few Gains Below Top Tier
